page.title: 09The Minster Lecterns
page.content: There are two lecterns in Southwell Minster, one in the choir and one in the nave. Lecterns are brass eagles, standing on a brass ball which has a stand. The one in the choir came from the bottom of a lake, baeause{Henry {VIII}wanted all the monasteries to be taken down. The monks of{Newstead {Abbey}threw their treasures into the lake. Later on it was one of the treasures picked up from the bottom of the lake. It was then put in a shop and someone bought it for the Minster. The one in the nave was only bought from a shop, it had no history behind it. Then we went to the pulpit. The pulpit is where the priests preach. They stand there so the people can see them and there is a microphone so people can hear them.
